column2: He had come down to the office very early, and for a few minutes was by himself.
column3: He had come down to the office very early, and for a few minutes was by himself.

column2: It will make up three columns and a half.
column3: It will make up three columns and a half.

column2: Yes--No.	Yes-no
He took the type-written matter just as it came from the telegraph editor and ran over it carefully.
column3: He took the type written matter just as it came from the telegraph editor and ran over it carefully.

column2: But--
column3: But-

column2: I don't think, Clark, that it ought to be printed, and that's the end of it, said Norman, looking up from his desk.
column3: I don't think, Clark, that it ought to be printed, and that's the end of it, said Norman, looking up from his desk.

column2: Do you mean that the paper is to go to press without a word of the prize fight in it?
column3: Do you mean that the paper is to go to press without a word of the prize fight in it?

column2: All the other papers will print it.
column3: All the other papers will print it.

column2: Norman looked at Clark thoughtfully.
column3: Norman looked at Clark thoughtfully.

column2: Clark came in and the two men faced each other alone.
column3: Clark came in and the two men faced each other alone.

column2: I have decided not to do a thing in connection with the paper for a whole year that I honestly believe Jesus would not do."
column3: I have decided not to do a thing in connection with the paper for a whole year that I honestly believe Jesus would not do."

column2: I think it will simply ruin the paper, replied Clark promptly.
column3: I think it will simply ruin the paper, replied Clark promptly.

column2: You can't make it pay. Just as sure as you live, if you shut out this prize fight report you will lose hundreds of subscribers.
column3: You can't make it pay. Just as sure as you live, if you shut out this prize fight report you will lose hundreds of subscribers.

column2: The very best people in town are eager to read it.
column3: The very best people in town are eager to read it.

column2: Surely, you can't afford to disregard the wishes of the public to such an extent.
column3: Surely, you can't afford to disregard the wishes of the public to such an extent.

column2: It will be a great mistake if you do, in my opinion."
column3: It will be a great mistake if you do, in my opinion."

column2: Then he spoke gently but firmly.
column3: Then he spoke gently but firmly.

column2: Clark, what in your honest opinion is the right standard for determining conduct?	Clark, what in your honest opinion is the right standard for determining conduct?
It can't be done.
column3: It can't be done.

column2: Norman did not reply at once.
column3: Norman did not reply at once.

column2: Clark rose.
column3: Clark rose.

column2: The report does not go in?
column3: The report does not go in?

column2: It does not.	It does not.
Clark walked out of the room to his own desk feeling as if the bottom had dropped out of everything.
column3: Clark walked out of the room to his own desk feeling as if the bottom had dropped out of everything.

column2: NEWS, sir?"
column3: NEWS, sir?"

column2: There's no prize fight here!
column3: There's no prize fight here!

column2: Look!"
column3: Look!"

column2: But he couldn't tell why, and ran over to the NEWS office to find out.
column3: But he couldn't tell why, and ran over to the NEWS office to find out.

column2: What's the matter here, George? he asked the clerk as he noted the unusual confusion.
column3: What's the matter here, George? he asked the clerk as he noted the unusual confusion.

column2: Boys, count them out, and I'll buy them tonight."
column3: Boys, count them out, and I'll buy them tonight."

column2: Fair!	Fair!
He walked out of the office and went home.
